data.chText: 极度的；极大的
data.enText: very great in degree

data.chText: 目前我们正在极大的压力下工作。
data.enText: We are working under extreme pressure at the moment.

data.chText: 生活在极度贫困中的人
data.enText: people living in extreme poverty

data.chText: 沙漠中极其炎热。
data.enText: The heat in the desert was extreme.

data.chText: 异乎寻常的；严重的；严厉的
data.enText: not ordinary or usual; serious or severe

data.chText: 只有在极端情况下才会让孩子离开父母。
data.enText: Children will be removed from their parents only in extreme circumstances .

data.chText: 千万不要做出诸如离开国家之类的极端行为。
data.enText: Don't go doing anything extreme like leaving the country.

data.chText: 这是我见过的最严重的虐待动物的事例。
data.enText: It was the most extreme example of cruelty to animals I had ever seen.

data.chText: 极端恶劣的天气状况
data.enText: extreme weather conditions

data.chText: 极端的；偏激的；过分的

before.enText: of people, political organizations, opinions, etc.

data.enText: far from what most people consider to be normal, reasonable or acceptable

data.chText: 极左 / 极右观点
data.enText: extreme left-wing/right-wing views

data.chText: 远离中心的；末端的；尽头的
data.enText: as far as possible from the centre, the beginning or in the direction mentioned

data.chText: 凯里位于爱尔兰的最西端。
data.enText: Kerry is in the extreme west of Ireland.

data.chText: 她坐在座位最边上。
data.enText: She sat on the extreme edge of her seat.

data.chText: 极端不同的感情（或境况、行为方式等）；完全相反的事物
data.enText: a feeling, situation, way of behaving, etc. that is as different as possible from another or is opposite to it

data.chText: 爱和恨两种截然不同的感情
data.enText: extremes of love and hate

data.chText: 他以前很腼腆，现在却走向了另一个极端。
data.enText: He used to be very shy, but now he's gone to the opposite extreme (= changed from one extreme kind of behaviour to another) .

data.chText: 极端；极度；极限
data.enText: the greatest or highest degree of sth

data.chText: 严寒、狂风、骤雨
data.enText: extremes of cold, wind or rain
go, etc. to extremes
take sth to extremes

data.chText: 走极端；被迫采取极端行为
data.enText: to act or be forced to act in a way that is far from normal or reasonable

data.chText: 他为了给上司留下深刻印象，不惜走极端，真令人难堪。
data.enText: It's embarrassing the extremes he'll go to in order to impress his boss.

data.chText: 这种行为如果走向极端则可能是非常危险的。
data.enText: Taken to extremes, this kind of behaviour can be dangerous.
in the extreme

data.chText: 极度；极端；非常
data.enText: to a great degree

data.chText: 这段旅程将会是极其危险的。
data.enText: The journey would be dangerous in the extreme.

means: 极端不同的感情(或境况、行为方式等)

data.enText: go, etc. to extremes
take sth to extremes

data.chText: 走极端；被迫采取极端行为
data.enText: to act or be forced to act in a way that is far from normal or reasonable

data.chText: 他为了给上司留下深刻印象，不惜走极端，真令人难堪。
data.enText: It's embarrassing the extremes he'll go to in order to impress his boss.

data.chText: 这种行为如果走向极端则可能是非常危险的。
data.enText: Taken to extremes, this kind of behaviour can be dangerous.
in the extreme

data.chText: 极度；极端；非常
data.enText: to a great degree

data.chText: 这段旅程将会是极其危险的。
data.enText: The journey would be dangerous in the extreme.

tr: the furthest or highest degree of something
the point located farthest from the middle of something
of the greatest possible degree or extent or intensity
far beyond a norm in quantity or amount or degree
beyond a norm in views or actions

value.def: Extreme means very great in degree or intensity.

example.ex: The girls were afraid of snakes and picked their way along with extreme caution.
example.tran: 女孩子们害怕蛇，走路时格外小心。
作者极不情愿进行归纳

value.def: You use extreme to describe situations and behaviour which are much more severe or unusual than you would expect, especially when you disapprove of them because of this.

example.ex: The extreme case was Poland, where 29 parties won seats...
example.tran: 极端的例子是波兰，共有29个政党拥有议席。

example.ex: It is hard to imagine Lineker capable of anything so extreme...
example.tran: 很难想象莱恩克尔能做出如此极端的事情。

example.ex: The scheme has been condemned as extreme.
example.tran: 人们指责该计划太过极端。

value.def: You use extreme to describe opinions, beliefs, or political movements which you disapprove of because they are very different from those that most people would accept as reasonable or normal.

example.ex: This extreme view hasn't captured popular opinion.
example.tran: 这种偏激的观点未被大众接受。

example.ex: ...the racist politics of the extreme right.
example.tran: 极右派的种族主义政治

value.def: You can use extremes to refer to situations or types of behaviour that have opposite qualities to each other, especially when each situation or type of behaviour has such a quality to the greatest degree possible.

example.ex: ...a 'middle way' between the extremes of success and failure...
example.tran: 成功和失败这两个极端之间的“中间地带”

example.ex: They can withstand extremes of temperature and weather without fading or cracking.
example.tran: 它们能够经受极端的气温和天气状况而不褪色、不破裂。

value.def: The extreme end or edge of something is its furthest end or edge.

example.ex: ...the room at the extreme end of the corridor.
example.tran: 在走廊尽头的那个房间

value.def: If a person goes to extremes or takes something to extremes, they do or say something in a way that people consider to be unacceptable, unreasonable, or foolish.

example.ex: The police went to the extremes of installing the most advanced safety devices in the man's house...
example.tran: 警方采取极端措施，在那个男子家里安装了最先进的安全装置。

example.ex: The doctor told me not to mention dieting to her in case she took it to the extreme...
example.tran: 医生告诉我不要跟她提节食的事儿，免得她走极端。

example.ex: There is a sense of shame, sometimes carried to extremes.
example.tran: 心中有羞愧感，有时候甚至无地自容。

value.def: You use in the extreme after an adjective in order to emphasize what you are saying, especially when you want to indicate that it is something which is undesirable or very surprising.

example.ex: It is proving controversial in the extreme...
Our rows become unhealthy in the extreme.
example.tran: 我们的争吵变得极其有害。

value.tran: （用于形容词后，尤用于强调不好或令人惊讶的事）极其，极度
